intro: Campanula raddeana, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features erect stems that can grow up to 60 cm in height, adorned with lance-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. Its flowers are typically 2–3 cm in diameter and have five lobes, giving them a distinctive campanulate appearance. Campanula raddeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, rocky soils.
